website_summaries.verdict: Particularly good for top bunk beds where wooden slats are unattractive, but a good value for any situation.
pros: Doesn’t make noise when moving around
cons: Fabric could make it slippery when tossing and turning in bed

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS LIKE A CHARM
customer_reviews.text: As a single mother - my budget is small. I had a cheap metal frame, box spring, and pillow top mattress - and my bed was sinking in. I was told it was my mattress - because the box spring wouldn't allow for sinking... so I wanted to try one thing before I ended up in more debt with a new mattress - and I ordered these slates! It felt like a WHOLE NEW BED. No more sinking - and great support. I can sleep again - and it came at a very cheap fix!!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to use but the queen size price has gone way up, please see comment.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to unfold and very effective for my memory foam mattress. The width can easily be adjusted by pushing together the slats a little bit or pulling them apart. I just noticed that the price for the queen size is much more than it used to be . I need another one so what I have done is I have ordered a king size which costs MUCH less, and since the slats can be pushed together to make it smaller I will make it into a queen size and save $100!
customer_reviews.author: M. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be good quality. See before and after pics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this purely for aesthetic reasons. I am using this on a top bunk bed. They are made with wood slats and cloth. Seems to be good quality. See before and after pics.I am happy with how this product looks. Underneath definitely looks better.
customer_reviews.author: sfoley

customer_reviews.title: Measurements are inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The measurement given, 41.7 inches width x 74.6 inches height, is not an accurate statement. The boards are in fact 37 inches width x 73 inches height. The excess they are probably measuring is the fabric, but that is not helpful, because this is a crucial difference. The boards being shorter than stated means that they are not functional for my bed frame, which requires the boards to be resting on top of the frame itself. (Two stars because the product itself is not damaged in any way)
customer_reviews.author: R. Rubin

customer_reviews.title: King size foundation
customer_reviews.text: I have a king size foundation where the slats are too far apart. When the fabric over the foundation slats stretched it caused my mattress to sag. Since the foundation slats go across the foundation cross ways these slats are perfect because they go length ways covering up the gap in the foundation slats. Because they criss cross foundation and these slats work together for strength
customer_reviews.author: Patrick M Pickett

customer_reviews.title: head-to-to direction slats and great for memory foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: My platform bed has 7 inch gaps between metal bars and this product corrects it to less than 3 inch gaps needed by memory foam mattress. Super easy to install. Fabric cover makes it safe for mattress. The slats lay in head-to-toe direction which is across the slats of my platform and that makes the whole setup very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Vadim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, works great
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged, and easy to assemble (if you can call it that, simply open and place on bed frame). The lengthwise slats with the fabric support in between were perfect for use on a bed frame what has a Avocado mattress on it. Couldn't ask for a simpler or better product, will buy a second one when another queen size bed is set up.
customer_reviews.author: SteelshooterCO

customer_reviews.title: it flexes a lot
customer_reviews.text: The slats are a lot thinner and flex a lot I had to continue to use my box spring and put the slats on top of this I hope it will help some since I need as little flex as possible due to a spine condition
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you need a solid support to ease your back pain forget this.
customer_reviews.text: If you need a solid support for your foam mattress this is not for you. The plywood is so soft so when you sleep on it. The mid section sink in. I bought it thinking that it will provide a better support for my back pain. This ain't work because the thin plywood just sagged in the middle when you sleep. So there is no support for your lumber region. Save you money and get a spring board based stead instead. Most of these wood or card board strip just don't work. It is a cheap solution but it doesn't work so it can be an expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.author: NYCHGUY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! We have one of those transitional cribs that went from a crib to a toddler bed to a double bed. We have 2 of them and they never come with enough slats. I have been researching forever and finally pulled the trigger and ordered this product. What I love is that it lays directly on top of the exsisting slats. No hammering no putting together. Easy 3 minute set up. And finally I love that the slats go from top to bottom. It makes the bed super sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Martinez

customer_reviews.title: quick fix for a serious problem
customer_reviews.text: We bought a queen bed that came with horizontal slats (cross bars with minimal support) , a standard 9in springbox made the mattress to high, so we used the mattress without springbox as recommended by the seller. After few weeks we noticed the horizontal slats on the bed sagged as well as annoying sound getting on and off the bed. We bought these vertical slats to place them on horizontal slats, these fixed the sag issue and noise. They are very sturdy and very nicely spaced to distribute load evenly. It definitely saved us money on the bed as well as our backs. We recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, We are very satisfied with our purchase. We bought two twins to use them with Better Homes & Gardens Leighton Twin-over-Twin Bunk Bed which has very separate slats and we wanted to use memory foam mattresses. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sofa Sleeper Support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a queen size sofa sleeper to put under the memory foam mattress to add firmer support, and they worked great! My only advice is to go down a size, get full size wood boards for a queen sofa sleeper (queen boards are to big/long) and you will obviously need to store them somewhere when you close up the sofa sleeper (garage, behind couch?).
customer_reviews.author: BE HAPPY

customer_reviews.title: Made a good nights sleep possible again
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a futon. My studio apartment is too small to accommodate a bed and a couch, so I bought a metal frame futon. The futon mattress is memory foam but after laying on it for a while I could feel the metal bars of the frame through the mattress. This easily corrected the problem.
customer_reviews.author: LycktySplyt

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit full size bed
customer_reviews.text: Well I ordered this for a full size bed, and as you can tell from the photo they do not fit a full size bed
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Box spring reinforcement
customer_reviews.text: Love the vertical, fabric covered wood slats. Came nice and straight in a box, 2 pieces for a queen size. I'm using it between a hollow wooden box foundation and flat bunkie boards (foam bed on top of all that). Sturdy as heck.
customer_reviews.author: nkr1

customer_reviews.title: Easy installment
customer_reviews.text: You just take out the box and throw them in place...no tools needed
customer_reviews.author: Hellcat

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs. Recently purchased a Pillowfort Osa Kids twin bunk bed. The wood bed slats were a little rough and spaced too far apart for my liking. The Zinus slats were a perfect solution and fit this twin bed perfectly. I used them in addition to the Pillowfort slats and didn’t add any significant height. Sorry I can’t comment on the comfort, since I’m pretty sure little ones sleep peacefully whether in the car, in mom’s lap, at the dinner table, in their beds, (or favorite) in mom&dads bed. :) Arrived packaged neatly & on time. I like the neutral color. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: zoe

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP and AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: Did absolutely nothing in supporting my mattress on my new bed. Slats broke and now I sleep on the couch. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would’ve gotten this five years ago! I thought it was my mattress that was so noisy, so after a few years, I bought a new one. When the noise and squeaks continued with the new mattress I decided to switch out the bunky board. Lo and behold, problem solved! This has been a lifesaver in terms of a quiet night’s sleep.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiMommy

customer_reviews.title: Works really good!
customer_reviews.text: I got a queen and it fits really well. In the last photo I only use my bed mattress no box springs and it feels amazing and it works really good I would recommend it if you don’t want to use a box spring! Easy assemble and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: makes the sofa bed usable!
customer_reviews.text: You can not feel the bar on the sofa bed any longer. It is easy to use by just rolling out the fabric on both sides. I'd recommend this for anyone with a sofa bed.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Problem Solver Item
customer_reviews.text: The four slats that came with the supposed platform bed we're not enough to support the 12" more than memory foam mattress that we purchased. After doing some research on how to solve the problem we came across this item. They are sturdy wood slats that are encased in a nice material so the wood won't snag the mattress. They come in two pieces and spread out the opposite way...length of the bed...of the original slats, that go the width of the bed, making it so no part of the mattress will sag through any of the slats. We are very glad we found these. They were an easy, inexpensive way to solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not very supportive
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but not as strong as I would have hoped. We actually returned this and purchased the zinus steel bunky board. I originally purchased this for my sons full size toddler bed conversion. It had 4 strong sturdy slats across & I thought that would be good with these vertical slate, but I was wrong. You could tell they were wanting to bend and not support the light mattress or any person on top. I could see this working for a metal bunk bed with a lot of horizontal slats to offer more support but If you’re wanting it for something like what I have, get a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra

customer_reviews.title: Definitely  helped
customer_reviews.text: I put it btwn the base and top mattress, had to stretch a couple of flat bungee cords across it to keep it from shifting as I placed (struggled) getting the top mattress back on place. It has definitely helped firm up the mid-mattress body dip. It's not a cure, but, a real improvement.
customer_reviews.author: SonoraTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist mattress support
customer_reviews.text: This product was extremely helpful in getting back to great sleep. I got a platform bed a few months ago that had advertising that a box spring was not needed. However, there weren’t enough slats for proper support, so I had to find a minimalist solution to fix my sagging mattress. This solution was perfect!!! Easy to roll out and now my mattress is level.
customer_reviews.author: Cella

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for old box spring
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Sweetnight 10" memory foam mattress that wasn't agreeing with the older box spring at my in laws guest bed. Most of the the box spring itself was ok but the center frame had cracked and caused the mattress to sag in the middle. We bought this to either sit inside the bed frame or in between the box spring and mattress, so we tried in the in between method and it worked wonders. Awesome buy.
customer_reviews.author: Freshies

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product
customer_reviews.text: Just remember to screw in four corners for each section. Otherwise, the material covered wood will move all over the place leaving your mattress sagging in places. There may have been instructions for that, but I don't recall. I just screwed my slats to the bed frame and I now don't have that problem. This would be the same for any manufacturer. Screw it or lose it. Great support.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCrazy

customer_reviews.title: Huge Improvement
customer_reviews.text: All summer my husband was waking up in agony at our cottage. He even resorted sometimes to sleeping on the floor. He spent many daytime hours on the floor trying to recoup. We had been using a Costco Bed-in-a-Box for several years. We had it on top a box spring from our set. There wasn't time to get a new mattress delivered with a trial period. So I decided to try these slats. Wow, what a difference for him. I, on the other hand, felt better sinking in. The slats come in 2 sections so I could remove them from my side of the bed. We will try my half on his side of the bed at home, too.
customer_reviews.author: tilemom

customer_reviews.title: Extra support
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go on top of a new platform bed frame and under a new Memory foam mattress. Product as described. Fast delivery.Just had to un-package it and lay it in top of the frame. The only problem is the covering made it very slippery on the metal frame. The mattress would move with the slightest movement. We solved this by putting a carpet gripper pad ( the ones that go under rugs to keep them From sliding on floors) on the bed frame, put the wooden slats with the covering on top of that,then added the mattress. Problem solved! I feel like the Wooden slats gives the mattress extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Does as described, isn’t presented that way.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty pissed at this items presentation and the overall purchase experience. Package was late, got the run around from amazon when inquiring and then when finally the package was delivered, it looked like someone had already beat me to the unboxing *pictures for reference*. The product itself had no visible damage and was pretty easy to install. Feels sturdy enough for me, but I don’t recommend standing/jumping in the bed. Gave it 3 stars because the experience was far from admirable, even with prime membership.
customer_reviews.author: KingAliyah

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't true to Size!!
customer_reviews.text: I sent it back! It didn't even fit my full sized foundation even though I bought a full sized one. Not worth the hassle I went through at all. I literally tried having it picked up 4 times while they kept saying they attempted pick up but my camera proved otherwise so at last minute I had no choice but to get someone to go 2.5 miles to nearest UPS to drop it off or they would have kept my money
customer_reviews.author: Millie Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Gave New Life to Older Mattress!
customer_reviews.text: My mattress is almost eight years old, but I'd like to get a couple more years out of it before I replace it. It was starting to feel too soft. I considered a topper but decided to try this instead, and I'm very happy that I did. It was easy to install between the mattress and box spring (I did lay down a length of gripper shelf liner under the slats to help them stay in place), and gave new life to my bed. Slept like a baby last night. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reader

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy fix for sagging bed
customer_reviews.text: We purchased new mattress and platform bed from separate sources, and were disappointed to wake with sore backs because the new bed sagged. Reading at the mattress's website, we realized that the platform was not rigid enough to properly support the mattress, so we started to figure out how to construct a supporting layer from nearby lumber supplies. Then some more research revealed the availability of prefab bunkie boards which would not cost much more and save the headaches of constructing our own from scratch. We picked the Zinus Annamarie after some comparative online shopping. The order was quickly fulfilled, and our new bed has become much more satisfactory in short order.
customer_reviews.author: Romain K

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a box spring alternative. It's ok... they feel a little flimsy as though they are going to break. If there is more than one person on the bed, the slats feel like they could break. In addition, the mattress sort of slumps in the middle a little which is annoying. I am kind of able to remedy this by putting an additional wooden board over the slats but that is still kind of uncomfortable. Can't say I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Get a new mattress instead of these cheap slats.
customer_reviews.text: These slats are a waste of $. More importantly, after buying them, my back initially felt better, but then began to hurt even worse. Your back is priceless, so don't try to save $ by keeping an old mattress. Now we have bought a new mattress and box spring. Don't keep an old mattress for longer than 9 or 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great addition but you cannot utilize this alone!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to your bed. My only comment is that I feel like it makes the biggest difference if you have a thinner mattress opposed to a thicker one. Combined with a high density firm topper I was able to make my mattress a little bit more firm for my back. If you have a thick mattress I don’t believe this can be the only fix for you. Additionally, this is something that you will need to put on your bed, especially a king, with another person. When you put down the slats the slats will slide from side to side when putting the mattress on unless you have an extra hand!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes saggy mattresses, but I can't handle them. Since he is resisting getting a new mattress, I bought the twin size of these for our king bed. They are well made and covered to prevent snags. It was easy to slip them under my side (I put them between the boxspring and mattress). I spread them out as far as they would go and they work great! The twin size fully supports my side of the mattress and reaches from the top to the bottom of my king mattress. It's my first full week of sleep and I can report a definite improvement. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer McFarland

customer_reviews.title: better than box spring
customer_reviews.text: what a great product! Wanted to throw out our old, heavy, dusty box spring but still wanted to keep the bed and mattress. Found this and tried it. It is a space saver, gives the bed a lower profile and sleek look and easily supported my guests without issue when they stayed with us. Loved it so much I got another for my sleep number bed. Needed extra support for the molded plastic base. Amazing difference! Like how the wood is covered in fabric. Makes it easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Richbone69

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, not very strong
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this bunkie board in that it was super simple to install. The issue is that two of the wood slats under this broke when someone who weighed 150lbs. sat on the bed. That's hardly a lot of weight so it made me scared for the future. I returned this product and bought their steel version, and that one is easily five stars. I'd recommend spending the extra $15 and getting the steel version - you have to put it together but the instructions are super easy.
customer_reviews.author: seek7500x

customer_reviews.title: Works great on sofa sleeper.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Bought the king because it was cheaper than the queen. I’m using it on a queen size sofa sleeper with a memory foam mattress. You don’t feel the bars or springs. Note: it sticks out about 6” because sofa sleeper mattresses are shorter. You could cut them down but we chose not to.
customer_reviews.author: michael sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great for fold out sofa bed
customer_reviews.text: Use this with a 5" memory foam matress and cannot feel any of the bars from the fold out frame. It feels very solid and makes the fold out much more comfortable. I purchased the queen for my queen fold out. A little longer than my fold out, but work great.
customer_reviews.author: Aliebs

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Are use this product to fix issues I had with a metal frame Fix the Squeak & the Pressure I was experiencing from the metal bars The only thing I would add to this product is a little bit of Velcro because on my bed it moves overtime and I have to readjust it.. which is Very easy to accomplish. Although I wasn’t going to look around I thought maybe the price was a little expensive. I do like the fact that the word is wrapped and cloth. I recommend this product if you’re looking for a FIXD or a metal bed frame or Slating replacement Overall I give it 5 to 5 stars because it fixed all my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew if its hardwood
customer_reviews.text: Looks & feels like it may support 2 avg adults. Box says 'Made in China'. No idea what type of wood is used since its wrapped in a breathable man-made fabric. I'm sure its made using metric measurements, so these slat dimensions are approximate US: thickness 9/16" x 3" wide. They are spaced 4" apart. We're using a metal queen frame with a center support (side-side), about 30" per section, which I thought might cause the mattress to sag & possibly cause the slats to break. So I added 2 additional supports made from left over decking & 1.25" dowel rod legs. The spacing between supports is now 15" & rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R.

customer_reviews.title: Mattress is more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to protect my metal smart base bed frame from being damaged. I have not had them long, but I believe they will work. They are basically wooden boards covered to prevent splintering or damage to your mattress. The queen size are two separate rolls of slats. You should have two people placing these on your frame, because they have a tendency to slide when you first lay the mattress down over them. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: b-reigns

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a new mattress
customer_reviews.text: When I moved out for university, I got a memory foam mattress. My mattress back at home was a eurotop mattress, so the difference was huge. This memory foam one didn’t hold its shape at all. There was a HUGE dip between the 3 support beams that held my mattress up off the floor. I’m glad I found this. My mattress now feels firm, that dip is gone, and I can finally sleep comfortably. I have a twin bed, and the twin size fit perfectly. I highly recommend this. Installation was simply and quick. The boards itself was sturdier than other boards I debated on purchasing. It’s been a few months and it’s still working well.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Pasia

customer_reviews.title: Affordable slats
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for slats to replace my box spring because I wanted to lower the height of the mattress and to have a harder sleeping surface. These slats were the most affordable and they are doing the job well. Very easy to put on the bed, as there are no screws etc. You just unfold the fabric. The fabric is a nice feature that protects the mattress from splinters. Although the slats just lie on top of the bed frame they have stayed quite stable so far and support the mattress well.
customer_reviews.author: ogg

customer_reviews.title: A bit slippery but does the trick
customer_reviews.text: These slats were the right size and super easy to install. They were priced cost effectively as well and fit the bed perfectly. As a note the slats are shipped in two sheets - one sheet goes on the right side and the other on the left side of the bed. The two pieces do shift slightly and I don’t know yet whether this will be a problem over time; but we needed the support because our bed frame needed additional support for our new one-piece mattress. We have also bought two non-slip rug pads to control the slippage and will install one pad between the slats and bed frame, and the other pad between the slats and mattress
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann S.

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed! Sleek, Strong, Cloth-Covered Bunkie Board
customer_reviews.text: I ordered four of these to go beneath memory foam mattresses for two sets of bunkbeds. The Zinus bunkie boards arrived in two days and came ready to use right out of the packages. Completely wrapped in plastic, they were pristine clean. The boards are cloth-covered, and unfold like a fan ... A perfect fit across the slats of the bunk beds. Very much like that the slats are lenghwise, making them perpendicular to the crosswise slats. Gives a very firm, full support beneath each mattress. Also, because they're cloth covered, the bottom gets a nice view as they look up. That's a nice bonus!
customer_reviews.author: CrazyOldNana

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to buying a boxspring! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: My kids had bunk beds & when we changed them into separate beds my older child ended up with the full size bottom bed. She’s heavier than my youngest and the mattress was sinking down between the slats at the head of the bed because we didn’t have a box spring. I searched Amazon and found this, which is similar to what came with our Casper mattress. It works so well! Extremely easy to install and a lot cheaper than buying a boxspring. I am very pleased with it and highly recommend it if you’re having an issue with your mattress sinking.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Clouatre

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the extra fabric surrounding the boards at both ends, but I was able to tuck it underneath the boards with some effort. My issue is that I bought a Zinus platform bed (10 in clearance) and there is zero room for a slim profile boxspring. Therefore, I was forced to buy this product in order to have something more solid than the bare wood slats to tuck my sheets against. I definitely would've gone with a different style Zinus bed had I known more about the design. This product would work better with a bed that has a lip for it to fit into.
customer_reviews.author: AmyJ

customer_reviews.title: No support for memory foam mattress
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because we were having sagging issues and needed more support. The boards actually bend and are too flexible, which leads to the boards still allowing the mattress to sag. When looking from the underside of the bed, when someone gets on the mattress, you can see everything sink. If you’re running into sagging issues I’d suggest a low profile box spring or get rid of the slats all together and get a platform base instead.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Was perfect for the twin top bunk
customer_reviews.text: Got my son a bunk bed for his bedroom in the new house (honestly a bride to get him to sleep in his own room!) and we needed “bunky boards”. We have some 2x4’s going across, so I liked that these went horizontal to provide a “cross hatch” support, and that from underneath you just look at clean white fabrics and not a mattress. Seems to work well, I feel comfortable getting up there with him and don’t feel like we’re gonna fall thru. I def wouldn’t want a kid jumping on a bed with these though...
customer_reviews.author: ATXangel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bunk bed taken apart Twin bed
customer_reviews.text: Brought this to go on my daughters twin bed as her original slates started to break There were 6 she is down to 4 brought this took it right out the box and put it right on top of the slates! It fits perfectly the shape of the bed so even with the missing slates you can’t tell because it fits the wooden frame that holds the slates. If anything changes I will update. It literally took the most time opening the box took 2 seconds to put it on the bed
customer_reviews.author: Meena

customer_reviews.title: As described, easy to add to existing slats/frame
customer_reviews.text: As described. Easy to add to an existing frame that already has slats. I have an old West Elm platform bed with dual slats, which they don’t sell separately anymore. I would have had to get them custom cut or opted for a low profile box spring. I went with this bunkie bed item because I could put these slats over the old ones for extra reinforcement without worrying about it fitting the actual frame precisely. Since there’s fabrics between the bunkie planks you can shift them closer together as needed. Since there are two sets, it worked perfectly for going over the old dual slats I already had.
customer_reviews.author: nomdeplume

customer_reviews.title: Great for bunk beds
customer_reviews.text: These bunkies are fantastic for bunk beds or even regular beds that need to have the mattress closer to the floor. On the top bunk for safety so the opt of the mattress does not get too close to the top of the rail or the bottom bunk for extra head clearance. They cross in the opposite direction as the cross pieces and keep the mattress from sagging down. The fabric keeps the wood stays in place and still provides some flex.
customer_reviews.author: TimothyNC

customer_reviews.title: Good if used along with horizontal slats
customer_reviews.text: Great when used with horizontal slats. Wood is thin so not very sturdy. I use with metal horizontal slat frame made by Zinus that fits perfectly on my raised bed frame for extra support. Cover material protects against splinters but also slips.
customer_reviews.author: Doggo luvr

customer_reviews.title: Definitely added support
customer_reviews.text: Yes- these go perpendicular to the bed slats. It definitely gives added support and sturdiness. We got a frame that initially had good reviews until I went digging a little deeper. I had already bought the bed so I was nervous. We got these to help support the mattress-just in case- our frame had the issues others complained of. It’s been great though. The only con is that they slip and slide, so just make sure you have help lifting the mattress and making sure they are fully extended underneath.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marks

customer_reviews.title: So much yes!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I bought this. My bed was high up and I was worried the kids would fall off, so I took the box spring out and put the mattress directly on the frame. The frame only had three wood slats, so for about a week it was collapsing inward and super annoying. We put this under the mattress and it's like a whole new bed. No more sinking into the ground any more. Feels sturdy and now the bed isn't too high. Recommend! Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Jessy Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it... Beams under broke instantly
customer_reviews.text: The beams underneath this on my daughter's bed broke the first time I had an adult sleep on the bed. Adult probably weighed 140 pounds :/ Installation was a piece of cake. You take it out the box and put than on each side of bed so they meet in the middle. The boards are VERY thin. It worked fine for my one and a half year when she would play on the bed. But when my friend went to sleep on bed, the board may as well not have been there at all, as the beams under broke instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Don’t settle for this buy something sturdier!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on product reviews. They weren’t inexpensive! They were one step above nothing. They bowed and were just miserable. Weak. My hubby had to sleep elsewhere and I had to order a sturdier product that was not inexpensive either!
customer_reviews.author: TAMARA HOPKINS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy slats, adds even more support to mattress.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the KING size bunkie board/slats to use on two TWIN beds. The king size comes in two separate pieces (5 slats per piece) that will fit two twin beds, I saved $20 by purchasing one king vs. 2 twins. The wooden slats are enclosed in fabric that is stitched at each end, this keeps the slats from sliding around. I had to cut approx 5” off each slat to get a perfect lengthwise fit for my bed frames, since they are designed for the bunkie board or mattress to slide right in and stay put. The slats appear to be very sturdy and makes the mattress feel even more comfy.
customer_reviews.author: TMac

customer_reviews.title: Utility is marginal to none.
customer_reviews.text: I want to return these. Very slippery. Move around under matress. This combined with a crappy bed frame purchased from Amazon was a huge waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Redtruckfan

customer_reviews.title: Added support for saggy mattress
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to buy some time in buying a new mattress. My mattress it’s too that old but has a deep sag in the middle from me sleeping in that spot. I bought a 4” memory foam but it didn’t help 100%. NOW I have this between the foam & mattress. Problem fixed!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Firm Feel
customer_reviews.text: Mattress needed a little more support so I purchased the slats. Turned mattress from a soft feel to a firm sleep. Bed is not more comfortable--went from too soft to too hard.. I wonder if wide vertical slats would be more comfortable than narrow vertical ones. Guess I will have to spring (ha) for a new mattress. That said, there is no assembly required. Unwrap, unfold, and lay it on the box spring or platform.
customer_reviews.author: L J

customer_reviews.title: Best sleep ever!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this made! I couldn't believe that removing a box spring and replacing it with something a simple as wooden boards could improve the quality of sleep so much. I haven't slept this soundly in forever. My box spring ripped during a move and my cat decided to play in it while I slept so I needed to replace it. I decided to try something different and it was worth it. I am so happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: clever1

customer_reviews.title: Thank You
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to thank you for a quality product. It was as described and easy to place on the bed frame. My favorite things were the care taken to package your product and especially that everything was recyclable, thank you, thank you! Even the little note cards were on recycle type paper and I also appreciated your note that was included. Overall, a very pleasant and unexpected transaction. Good luck in your endeavors in the business world.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a brilliant solution to an annoying problem. I needed 6” mattresses for bunk beds and opted for foam for comfort, but faced the issue of slats that were too far apart. These not only make for a sturdy base but also greatly improve the look of the bed looking up from the bottom bunk (not that anyone cares, but it’s a nice bonus). Can’t rate them highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Too long, but holds up mattress
customer_reviews.text: Set up easy. Used under double bed mattress only on cheap metal frame. They seem to hold up the bed so far. (I'll update if they don't.) Only problem is they are longer than the mattress and frame (which are identical in length). We pushed all 3 to be flush at the foot of the bed, and we put the excess at the head so the bed is a little away from the wall. We might cut them off it becomes a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Fixed an uncomfortable pull out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to place under the mattress on a pull out chair bed. As is normal with all pull out beds, the support bar can be felt through the mattress making laying on the bed unbearable. These slats worked perfectly, taking the sleeper's weight off the bar and allowing for a great night's sleep.
customer_reviews.author: H.A. Solis

customer_reviews.title: This moves way too much causing lack of support.
customer_reviews.text: This slides all over the place. We have a platform bed and a Purple brand mattress. We bought the slats to help support the Mattress. Instead on a daily basis we soon in the edges because the slats do not stay still what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: LondonDungeon

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent
customer_reviews.text: I bought a brand new king size bed 3 months ago, and for the last 2 months the slats had been creaking very loudly. Every time I got into bed, or shifted slightly, or rolled. Honestly, it was not just annoyed but I was worried that getting up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom could wake the entire house. I ordered this product and not only was it the easiest thing to put in place, but it has COMPLETELY SOLVED the creaking. Granted I've only had it on for 2 days, but man what a difference! Not even the slightest hint of a sound now, no matter what movement I make!
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: All slats should come fabric covered IMO
customer_reviews.text: Zenus should concider fabric covers on all the slats they sell! I bought this to go on top of a zenus frame we bought, the wooden slats provided were spaced much too far apart and we needed better support for our new foam mattress. So I got this! This product had the added bonus of fabric covering which I love because it prevents against snags and tears in the mattress covering!
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my problem and more!
customer_reviews.text: I broke one of the wooden slats on my Novogratz bed and had a hard time trying to find/buy a replacement. I did a little research and came across this bunkie board and it solved my slat problem! But not only that, I didn't even realize I was having back problems because of the way my mattress was sinking into the bed frame! I also noticed a difference in my sleep after using this board! I didn't feel like I was sinking in my bed! My back posture feels like I'm laying straighter in the bed! Helped with my breathing too! This is a good product and I recommend it! No set up needed! Just unfold and lay it down!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Washington

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to use memory foam mattress on box springs.
customer_reviews.text: Was an easy fix to use a memory foam mattress on box springs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: needed extra support
customer_reviews.text: my bed and mattress are new but I felt the slat support that came with the bed was not the best support. Our mattress is firm and it certainly didn’t feel like it. I bought this for extra support and I am happy thus far. We have a cal king I ordered king due to zinus not offering cal king. slats line up with the horizontal slats on bed now and the width was adjusted by “closing in” these new ones. I don’t foresee any issue in doing that. So far I’m happy
customer_reviews.author: LGRiver

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together! Can’t complain wth something that was reasonably priced and perfectly fit .
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bed support in lieu of box frame
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the part I needed to offer support for the incomplete bed frame sold by the furniture store. Easy to unpack; easy to lay into the base of the bed frame and offers perfect support. Bravo! This is a perfect solution for the bed. Thank you! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: PandaBear2Hug

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: My son's bunk bed is sturdy - except that at each end, the mattress bows if I put any weight on it, creating a gap between it and the frame. Setting this underneath the mattress completely eliminated that problem. Easy to install, too! The bed I installed it on is a low loft, the top edge only 6" shorter than I am. I was able to strip & move the mattress, settle the slats on the frame, spread them properly, set the mattress back in place, and test it within 20 minutes of delivery.
customer_reviews.author: mathkitten

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fit for my queen platform
customer_reviews.text: I waited for these specific bed slats to be back stock, because the reviews were positive. My queen platform bed had a few horizontal bars so I figure it’s best it needs vertical bed slats vs horizontal bed slats. For some reason the horizontal bed slats got bad reviews. Anyways my mattress (non foam/non pillow top) feels supported. Also the slats fit my 60x80 opening, no need for adjustments!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as a bunky board would with minimal shipping costs! It is also much easier for one person to manage. It made a little noise the first couple of nights, which made me nervous. Now that it has been in use for over a month I feel as if it was a wise purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia S.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get the mattress back on
customer_reviews.text: This product works great, exactly as intended, and gives me the support I need. That said, I almost died trying to get my mattress on the darn thing! The fabric slats catch on everything, making it almost impossible to move your mattress without moving them too. I really wish they were only attached by strips of fabric instead of being fully wrapped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SLATS RUN WRONG WAY
customer_reviews.text: CANNOT USE BECAUSE SLATS RUN LENGTHWISE AND IT IS NOT ONE PIECE AS SHOWN.
customer_reviews.author: L. Muller

customer_reviews.title: Easy and well made
customer_reviews.text: Remove from packing, flip them out. Using on a queen platform; Easy and well made. Odor free. Will update review after using for awhile
customer_reviews.author: Bubba here

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, not queen
customer_reviews.text: These are 2 sets of slats, the together are supposed to be queen size. They are vertical. The fact that they are split makes it easy for a small , older person to get them on and off the bed. However , despite the stated measurements, they are too narrow for my standard queen bed, and either have a large gap with no support in the middle, or don't fit up to the edges.
customer_reviews.author: mg New York

customer_reviews.title: Great Support - Super Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add extra support to a daybed. It was super easy to remove from the box and lay on top of the slats of the daybed. The bed held up to 500#, but I feel better knowing the extra support is there. Two people have slept in the bed and found it comfortable. There is absolutely no noise from the support or slats. I think the cover on the Zinus product helped eliminate any noise. I’d recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile alternative to a box spring
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an Ikea Espevar with this because I raised the bed frame and needed something low profile. Very sturdy and well made. What would make it better is if it provided with a way to lock the slat in-place, to prevent it from shifting underneath the mattress, because I don't think the fabric would be enough. I used duck tape to tape the end slats to the bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Dream
customer_reviews.text: Our mattress is a soft, memory foam kind supported by four horizontal boards. Over time, it began dipping down between the support which made getting in and out of the bed a total hassle. In come these new supports and it feels like a brand new bed for about $60 bucks. Installation was quick and easy and I couldn't be happier with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: This is the best, no bar feel, support for sofa bed
customer_reviews.text: If you care about your guest, that sleep on your sofa bed, buy this support. We purchased the best mattress for our new sofa bed. It is passing for A nights sleep. That being said, not for long term visitors. We can store this support in the colet when it isn’t needed. We purchased a full size support for our queen sofa bed. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: M and G California

customer_reviews.title: Great for added support to a metal bed frame
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a new metal bed frame that works well, however when I would make the bed, the sheet would hang underneath. By adding the wooden slats which are enclosed in fabric and runs from the foot to the head of the bed, it supports the sheet, as well as better support at the foot of the bed. The only downside would be the added height to the bed, but I prefer not having to look at a made up bed with its sheet drooping onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was a little hesitant about ordering. After receiving the product, and using it, I so glad I didn’t let the negative reviews sway me. When installed right this wood base is more then I hoped for. It supports my king size bed perfectly and I have never slept better. I love this base! Can’t say enough good things about it. Easy to install, supportive, quiet and made my nights sleeping something to look forward to. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Shop girl

customer_reviews.title: Great instead of a box spring
customer_reviews.text: I like that it comes in two pieces, so I can adjust them to fit my bed frame exactly (bought for a full, but can use for a queen). I had to use the old slats, five of them, from side to side since the antique frame didn't have a center support with a foot. Also, had to be careful when putting the mattress on so they did not slide out of place. Pleased!
customer_reviews.author: LISA V MAZEY

customer_reviews.title: Helped sagging mattress
customer_reviews.text: Saved me from having to replace my 5 year old mattress. I had a hybrid mattress that was on a metal “box spring” because we couldn’t fit the original one up a narrow stairwell. The mattress was stating to sag and became really uncomfortable. Figured I would try this before purchasing a new mattress. It is amazing!! My bed is so much more comfortable now. Wonderful purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Adams

customer_reviews.title: Too big for Zinus Judy bed
customer_reviews.text: Just moved across the country and horrible movers stole/lost the bed slats for my Zinus Judy bed. Can’t find a replacement for the horizontal slats so I got these. They’re too long for my frame and won’t stay in place. Another reviewer suggested screwing them in, which I did but not sure that will work. I’m giving it another week and then I’ll decide if it’s time to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Marian K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Support!
customer_reviews.text: Gave great support for my heavy foam mattress! My mattress is 14" tall and with the my box spring I basically had to jump on my bed. I decided to get rid my my box spring and just use the slats that came with my bed frame...turns out....that doesn't work with a heavy foam mattress. I was basically sinking into my bed. Found this gem online for a great price. Took 5 minutes to unpack and install. NO MORE SAGGY MATTRESS and it's at the height I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: jeanine ridener

customer_reviews.title: clever design
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a bucky board to add support under a new mattress, I was annoyed to discover that most are mostly cardboard. I thought I was going to have to buy heavy, unwieldy sheets of plywood, but by running the slats the opposite way to the ones built into the bed, this gave just as good support and was far easier, cleaner, and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith A. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Works great, helps if your on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a lumpy futon. My mom has this cheap futon full size and the thing was god awful to sleep on, so I got these and it definitely helped give my back some more support. It definitely helps when your on a budget and need some extra support for a lumpy futon. Product came delivered on time, no issues with damage, and sturdy. They are covered too and super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Paco Picky

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Install - Just Unfold!
customer_reviews.text: This product far exceeded my expectations. First of all it comes in two pieces. Just like the video shows you just unfold them. We put it on a queen platform bed frame. Placed the mattress on top. That's it! And it feels great. Now this bed is ready for Christmas holiday guests. Great product. highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T and P Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected
customer_reviews.text: We're using memory foam mattresses with our kids bunk beds and these slat rolls are a good alternative to expensive bunky-boards. They work just as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cosgrove

customer_reviews.title: Making noise
customer_reviews.text: Trying to reach the company with no luck, I don’t know what to do, I have this under my mattress already and it’s making a squeaking noise, I’ve already tossed the box out because it look like it was going to work, now I don’t know what to do it I’m trying to reach the company hopefully somebody will read this and be able to help me
customer_reviews.author: Helen Mcintosh,

product_meta.title: Zinus Annemarie Solid Wood Bed Support Slats / Fabric-Covered / Bunkie Board, Full
product_meta.description: Size:FullThe Zinus Annemarie solid wood bed support slats are uniquely designed to be placed from the head of the bed to the foot to offer superior mattress support. Strong and sturdy wood slats are attractively encased in fabric, offering the best foundation for your spring, memory foam, or Hybrid mattress. The slats are shipped to your door in compact packaging that allows for ease of movement through tight interior spaces, such as stairs and hallways. Worry-free 5- year warranty.
feature_bullets: Strong and sturdy support for your memory foam, hybrid, or spring mattress
6 slats for twin, 9 slats for full, 10 slats for queen, 12 slats for king
Place vertically from head of the bed to foot instead of horizontally for maximum support
No assembly required just remove from packaging and put in place/ ideal for platform beds, bunk beds, and daybeds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,198 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
